entry.title: Comments On "Three Paradox of Quantum Information"
entry.summary: Comments On "Three Paradox of Quantum Information"

entry.title: A Quantum Past
entry.summary: This paper discusses the formulations of the past in quantum mechanics.

entry.title: Nonlinear Schroedinger equation and two-level atoms
entry.summary: General features of nonlinear quantum mechanics are discussed in the context of applications to two-level atoms.

entry.title: Triple bracket generalization of quantum mechanics
entry.summary: An extension of the Liouville-von Neumann dynamics to a Nambu-type dynamics is proposed. The resulting theory is the first version of nonlinear QM which is free from internal inconsistencies.

entry.title: An optical method for teleportation
entry.summary: A teleportation method using standard present day optical technology is presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: minor changes and a reference added

entry.title: Higher order Schmidt decompositions
entry.summary: Necessary and sufficient conditions are given for the existence of extended Schmidt decompositions, with more than two subspaces.

entry.title: Quantum Mechanics as an Exotic Probability Theory
entry.summary: Recent results suggest that quantum mechanical phenomena may be interpreted as a failure of standard probability theory and may be described by a Bayesian complex probability theory.

entry.title: On Hegerfeldt's paradox
entry.summary: The acausal behavior of relativistic states exhibited by Hegerfeldt is shown not to be present in physical systems described by first order in time evolution equations.

author.name: Ludger Hannibal
author.arxiv:affiliation: Carl v. Ossietzky Universitaet Oldenburg, Germany

entry.title: Simulations of Many-Body Quantum Systems by a Quantum Computer
entry.summary: We suggest that quantum computers can solve quantum many-body problems that are impracticable to solve on a classical computer.

entry.title: Reply to Comment: Quantum Cryptography Based on Orthogonal States?
entry.summary: This is our Reply to Peres' Comment [quant-ph/9509003] to "Quantum Cryptography Based on Orthogonal States" [Phys. Rev. Lett. 75, 1239 (1995)].

entry.title: Comment on "Sonoluminescence as Quantum Vacuum Radiation"
entry.summary: The insufficiency of the energy radiated in the model of Eberlein is discussed.

entry.title: Comment on quant-ph/9509008 by Kumar and Khare
entry.summary: One can find some comments related to the isospectral issue

entry.title: Sonoluminescence as Quantum Vacuum Radiation, Reply to Comments
entry.summary: Reply to Comments by Lambrecht, Jaekel, and Reynaud, and by Garcia and Levanyuk, submitted to Physical Review Letters.

entry.title: On the EPR Phenomenon
entry.summary: The origin of the nonlocal nature of quantum mechanics is investigated in the context of Everett's formulation of quantum mechanics. EPR phenomenon can fully be explained without introducing any kind of decoherence.

entry.title: Experimental realization of any discrete operator
entry.summary: A straightforward argument shows that, by allowing counterfactual elements of physical reality, any arbitrary discrete finite-dimensional operator corresponds to an observable.

entry.title: More on Static Quantum Computation
entry.summary: The construction of a universal static quantum computer actually provides another proof of the NP-hardness of spin-glass problems.

entry.title: Can single-photon states violate causality?
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn.

entry.title: Data processing in quantum information theory
entry.summary: The strengthened data processing inequality have been proved. The general theory have been illustrated on the simple example.

entry.title: Remarks on Bounds for Quantum Codes
entry.summary: We present some results that show that bounds from classical coding theory still work in many cases of quantum coding theory.

entry.title: Intrinsic chaoticity in stable classical systems and quantum fluctuations
entry.summary: The paper has been withdrawn

entry.title: Trajectory-coherent states for the Caldirola - Kanai Hamiltonian
entry.summary: In this paper we construct the trajectory-coherent states for the Caldirola - Kanai Hamiltonian. We investigate the properties of this states.

entry.title: Wigner function and decoherence
entry.summary: I briefly review the role of the Wigner function in the study of the quantum-to-classical transition through interaction with the environment (decoherence).
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, LATEX, contribution to Wigner Symposium

entry.title: Unconditionally Secure Multi-Party Computation
entry.summary: This paper was withdrawn on 20.11.97.

entry.title: Unconditionally Secure All-Or-Nothing Disclosure of Secrets
entry.summary: This paper was withdrawn on 20.11.97.

entry.title: Secure Multi-Party Addition via Quantum States
entry.summary: This paper was withdrawn on 20.11.97.

entry.title: Is Quantum Bit Commitment Really Impossible?
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn: the proposed method is insecure. I thank H-K. Lo and H. F. Chau for helpful correspondences

entry.title: Quantum Bit Commitment from a Computation Bound
entry.summary: This paper is withdrawn. See quant-ph/9806031 for a discussion.

entry.title: Permanently Secure Quantum Bit Commitment from a Temporary Computation Bound
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn. See quant-ph/9806031 for a discussion.

entry.title: Another Way to Perform the Quantum Fourier Transform in Linear Parallel Time
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn.

entry.title: Comparing the strengths of various Bell inequalities
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn because it is superseded by quant-ph/9905084 "Bayesian analysis of Bell inequalities.

entry.title: A Design for a Quantum Time Machine
entry.summary: This paper has been retracted, for obvious reasons.

entry.title: Nonlocality Without Inequalities for all Pure Entangled States
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors.

entry.title: Quantum differential forms
entry.summary: Formalism of differential forms is developed for a variety of Quantum and noncommutative situations.

entry.title: An Alternative Algorithm for the Database Search Problem on a Quantum Computer
entry.summary: The paper has been withdrawn

entry.title: The Error in Bell's Theorem
entry.summary: An error in the proof of Bell's Theorem is identified and a semiclassical model of the EPRB experiment is presented

entry.title: The halting problem for universal quantum computers
entry.summary: The halting of universal quantum computers is shown to be incompatible with the constraint of unitarity of the dynamics.

entry.title: All Optical Quantum Teleportation
entry.summary: We propose an all optical, continuous variable, quantum teleportation scheme based on optical parametric amplifiers.

entry.title: Questions on the concept of time
entry.summary: Some notes and questions about the concept of time are exposed. Particular reference is given to the problem in quantum mechanics, in connection with the indeterminacy principle.

entry.title: Relativistic Collapse Model With Tachyonic Features
entry.summary: A finite relativistic model for free particles, which describes the collapse of the statevector, is presented.

entry.title: Nonlocality without inequalities using unambiguous discrimination between non-orthogonal states
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn.

entry.title: Classification of Maximally Entangled States of Spin-1/2 Particles
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn temporarily.

entry.title: Time Asymmetric Quantum Physics
entry.summary: Mathematical and phenomenological arguments in favor of asymmetric time evolution of micro-physical states are presented.

entry.title: Some remarks on time, uncertainty, and spin
entry.summary: Some observations are made about energy-time uncertainty and spin in the context of trajectories as in Faraggi-Matone or Floyd.

entry.title: Quantum Information is physical too
entry.summary: We discuss the physical nature of quantum information, in particular focussing on tasks that are achievable by some physical realizations of qubits but not by others.

entry.title: Comment on `Experimental Entanglement Swapping: Entangling Photons That Never Interacted'
entry.summary: We comment on the experimental realisation of entanglement swapping by Pan et al. [Phys. Rev. Lett. 80, 3891 (1998)].

entry.title: Comment on ``A local hidden variable model of quantum correlations exploiting the detection loophole''
entry.summary: We study in this short comment the analogies and the differences that exist between several local hidden variable models.

entry.title: Quantum Data Processing
entry.summary: We prove a data processing inequality for quantum communication channels, which states that processing a received quantum state may never increase the mutual information between input and output states.

entry.title: Bell theorem involving all possible local measurements
entry.summary: The Bell theorem for a pair of two-state systems in a singlet state is formulated for the entire range of measurement settings.

entry.title: Two dimensional nonlinear dynamics of evanescent-wave guiding atoms in hollow fiber
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn due to same as quant-ph/9908068

entry.title: Computability Superselection Rule and its physical explanation
entry.summary: Paper erroneously re-submitted as duplicte. Readers should look at math-ph/9909004.

entry.title: NMR spectroscopy and computing beyond myth and fiction
entry.summary: Only craziness I am ashamed about.
entry.arxiv:comment: I am ashamed to have written this paper

entry.title: Large Numbers, the Chinese Remainder Theorem, and the Circle of Fifths
entry.summary: This is a pedagogical article cited in the foregoing research note, quant-ph/9911050
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages; Plain TeX with vanilla.sty and pictex.tex macros

entry.title: Quantum theory of incompatible observations
entry.summary: Maximum likelihood principle is shown to be the best measure for relating the experimental data with the predictions of quantum theory.

entry.title: Relativistic Quantum Computing
entry.summary: We present some informal remarks on aspects of relativistic quantum computing.

entry.title: Universe as quantum computer
entry.summary: This paper shows that universal quantum computers possess decoherent histories in which complex adaptive systems evolve with high probability.

entry.title: Hidden assumptions in decoherence theory
entry.summary: The role of implicit assumptions in current decoherence theory is pointed out and clarified.

entry.title: Quantum authentication protocol
entry.summary: In this letter, we proposed a quantum authentication protocol. The authentication process is implemented by the symmetric cryptographic scheme with quantum effects.

entry.title: Noether Theorem and the quantum mechanical operators
entry.summary: We show that the quantum mechanical momentum and angular momentum operators are fixed by the Noether theorem for the classical Hamiltonian field theory we proposed.

entry.title: Stochastic quantization of the dynamics of interacting qubit systems
entry.summary: Only craziness I am ashamed about.
entry.arxiv:comment: Only craziness I am ashamed about

entry.title: Some remarks on separability of states
entry.summary: Several problems concerning separable states are clarified on the basis of Choi's scheme and old Kadison and Tomiyama results. Moreover, we generalize Terhal's construction of positive maps.

entry.title: Parallel and Anti-Parallel Spins: More Differences
entry.summary: The authors have withdrawn this paper.
entry.arxiv:comment: this paper is withdrawn by the authors

entry.title: Coherent Control of Magneto-optical Rotation
entry.summary: The paper has been withdrawn by authors.

entry.title: On quantum evolution as a parallel transport
entry.summary: Time-dependent quantum evolution is described by an algebraic connection on a $C^\infty(R)$-module of sections of a $C^*$-algebra (or Hilbert) fibre bundle.

entry.title: Quantum Time-Frequency Transforms
entry.summary: Time-frequency transforms represent a signal as a mixture of its time domain representation and its frequency domain representation. We present efficient algorithms for the quantum Zak transform and quantum Weyl-Heisenberg transform.

entry.title: Controlled Quantum Teleportaion
entry.summary: A theoretical scheme for controlled quantum teleportation is presented, using the entanglement property of GHZ state.

entry.title: Asymptotically Good Quantum Codes
entry.summary: Using algebraic geometry codes we give a polynomial construction of quantum codes with asymptotically non-zero rate and relative distance.

entry.title: What can biology bestow to quantum mechanics?
entry.summary: The biological hierarchy and the differences between living and non-living matter are considered from the standpoint of quantum mechanics.

entry.title: Three dimensional time and energy operators and an uncertainty relation
entry.summary: Three dimensional time and energy operators are introduced and an uncertainty relation between them is proved.

entry.title: Reply to `No Contradictions between Bohmian and quantum mechanics'
entry.summary: Marchildon's claim (quant-ph/0007068) regarding Ghose's papers (quant-ph/0001024 and 0003037) is shown to be erroneous.

author.name: Partha Ghose
author.arxiv:affiliation: S N Bose National Centre for Basic Sciences, Calcutta

entry.title: Approximation Errors
entry.summary: A bound on the error introduced by truncating a quantum addition is given. This bound shows that only a few controlled rotation gates will be necessary to get a reliable computation.

entry.title: Shor's Quantum Factoring Algorithm
entry.summary: This paper is a written version of a one hour lecture given on Peter Shor's quantum factoring algorithm.

entry.title: Can We Obtain Quantum Theory From Reasonable Axioms?
entry.summary: See quant-ph/0101012
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn since it has been superseded by "Quantum theory from five reasonable axioms" - quant-ph/0101012

entry.title: Interferometric Tests of Teleportation
entry.summary: We investigate a direct test of teleportation efficacy based on a Mach-Zehnder interferometer. The analysis is performed for continuous variable teleportation of both discrete and continuous observables.

entry.title: Entangled state based on nonorthogonal state
entry.summary: Properties of entangled states based on nonorthogonal states are clarified. Especially, it is shown that they can have complete degree of entanglement.

entry.title: Quantum Logic
entry.summary: We investigate some forms of quantum logic arising from the standard and the unsharp approach.

entry.title: Comment on "Maximum likelihood reconstruction of CP maps", quant-ph/0009104
entry.summary: The treatment proposed by Sacchi quant-ph/0009104 does not represent correct solution, since the necessary conditions on CP maps are not guaranteed.

entry.title: A Lecture on Quantum Logic Gates
entry.summary: In this note we make a short review of constructions of n-repeated controlled unitary gates in quantum logic gates.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: The Bulletin of Yokohama City University, 53(2002) 81-90

entry.title: The Use of NMR for Solving the Problems of Quantum Computers
entry.summary: The analysis of papers on usage NMR in quantum computations is provided and the probable direction of the future investigations are considered.

entry.title: Shannon entropy and blackbody radiation
entry.summary: A response to criticism of the author's previous paper quant-ph/0002084.

entry.title: Comments on "On Bohm trajectories in two-particle interference devices" by L. Marchildon
entry.summary: Marchildon's arguments against my earlier work are refuted.

entry.title: Random Behaviour in Quantum Chaos
entry.summary: We investigate toy dynamical models of energy - level repulsion in quantum (quasi)energy eigenvalue sequences.

entry.title: The Structure of the Multiverse
entry.summary: The structure of the multiverse is determined by information flow.

entry.title: Comments on discrete time in quantum mechanics
entry.summary: The possibility that time can be regarded as a discrete parameter is re-examined. We study the dynamics of the free particle and find in some cases superluminal propagation.

entry.title: Comments on the Aharonov-Casher effect
entry.summary: We study the basic requirements for neutron confinement in the framework of some 3-D Aharonov-Casher configurations.

entry.title: Remarkable relations for the expectation values of simultaneous action of the kinetic and potential energy operators on Schrodinger wavefunctions
entry.summary: Witdrawn. Error in Eq.(14).

entry.title: Is entanglement observer-dependent?
entry.summary: The properties of quantum entanglement are examined and the role of the observer is pointed out.

entry.title: Decoherence : An irreversible Process
entry.summary: A wide-ranging theory of decoherence is derived from the quantum theory of irreversible processes, with specific results having for their main limitation the assumption of an exact pointer basis.

entry.title: Exact solutions of effective mass Schroedinger equations
entry.summary: We outline a general method of obtaining exact solutions of Schroedinger equations with a position dependent effective mass. Exact solutions of several potentials including shape invariant potentials have also been obtained.

entry.title: Some Good Error-Correcting Codes from Algebraic-Geometric Codes
entry.summary: Algebraic-geometric codes on Garcia-Stichtenoth family of curves are used to construct the asymptotically good quantum codes.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: IEEE Transactions on Information theory, VOL. 47, no.5, July, 2001

entry.title: Path Integration for the Plane Pendulum with Finite Amplitude
entry.summary: Exact path integration for the one dimensional potential $V=b^2\cos 2q$ which describes the finite amplitude pendulum is presented.

entry.title: Greenberger-Horne-Zeilinger paradoxes for N quNits
entry.summary: In this paper we show the series of Greenberger-Horne-Zeilinger paradoxes for N maximally entangled N-dimensional quantum systems.

entry.title: Superluminal information transmission using a double-double-slit apparatus
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn

entry.title: A Proposed Quantum Low Density Parity Check Code
entry.summary: We propose a new CSS code based on the finite geometry low density parity check code of Kou, Lin, and Fossorier.

entry.title: Coherent Decays of Atoms
entry.summary: Re-considering this work.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors. 8 pages

entry.title: Quantum computer and its quasiclassical model
entry.summary: Could the theories with hidden variables be employed for creation of a quantum computer? A particular scheme of quasiclassical model quantum computer structure is describe.

entry.title: A fully efficient secure quantum cryptography protocol
entry.summary: The paper has been withdrawn by the author since the protocol is not new. It is just the oldest version of BB84.

entry.title: Irreducibility of n-ary quantum information
entry.summary: Quantum information is radically different from classical information in that the quantum formalism (Hilbert space) makes necessary the introduction of irreducible ``nits,'' n being an arbitrary natural number (bigger than one), not just bits.

entry.title: Arbitrary classical privicy amplification can be used for the quantum key distribution
entry.summary: The paper is withdrawn.

entry.title: Entanglement and perfect quantum error correction
entry.summary: The entanglement of formation gives a necessary and sufficient condition for the existence of a perfect quantum error correction procedure.

entry.title: Procrastinated Codes
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author.

entry.title: On the function sum(-k^2/s^2)
entry.summary: Some properties of the function$ \psi (s)=\sum\limits_{k=-\infty}^\infty {% \exp (-\frac{{k^2}}{{s^2}}})$ are studied, and an interpolation formula is given.

entry.title: Transmit Classical and Quantum Information Secretly
entry.summary: This note presents a practical cryptography protocol for transmitting classical and quantum information secretly and directly.

entry.title: Entangled States and Local Measurements
entry.summary: We show that the maximum entanglement in a composite system corresponds to the maximum uncertainty and maximum correlation of local measurements.

entry.title: FAQ about the "contextual objectivity" point of view
entry.summary: We discuss some Frequently Asked Questions about the ``contextual objectivity" point of view on quantum mechanics introduced in two previous preprints quant-ph/0012122 and quant-ph/0111154.

entry.title: A new class of non-Hermitian Hamiltonians with real spectra
entry.summary: We construct a new class of non-Hermitian Hamiltonians with real spectra. The Hamiltonians possess one explicitly known eigenfunction.

entry.title: Quantum logic gates and maximally entangled states in microtraps
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn because the first author submitted the paper without previously consulting the rest of the authors.

entry.title: Wavepacket and its collapse
entry.summary: The notions of wavepacket and collapse are discussed and a local-realistic interpretation of Berkeley experiment is done.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages including 2 figures and 7 references. As a reply to R.Y.Chiao's and P.G.Kwiat's paper quant-ph/0201036 v2, 23.01.2002

entry.title: Entangling two-level atoms by spontaneous emission
entry.summary: It is shown that the dissipation due to spontaneous emission can entangle two closely separated two-level atoms.

entry.title: Separability, Preferred Bases, and the Nonconservation of Quantities
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn.

entry.title: Power series Schrodinger eigenfunctions for a particle on the torus
entry.summary: The eigenvalues and a series representation of the eigenfunctions of the Schrodinger equation for a particle on the surface of a torus are derived.

entry.title: Multiparty d-dimensional quantum information splitting
entry.summary: Generalization of quantum information splitting protocol from qubits to qudits (quantum d-dimensional systems) is presented.

entry.title: Outline for a formal general theory of physical measurements
entry.summary: The paper gives the main lines of a general theory for physical measurements.

entry.title: Hydrodynamic Models of Quantum Mechanics
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author.

entry.title: Reply to: Comment on "Quantum Optimization for Combinatorial Searches"
entry.summary: This is my reply to Zalka and Brun's criticism of my recent paper on quantum optimization heuristics. Essentially, this criticism is shown to be utterly irrelevant.

entry.title: Are classical probabilities instances of quantum amplitudes?
entry.summary: A conjecture about the quantum nature of classical probabilites is set forth and discussed.

entry.title: Bell's theorem in the presence of classical communication
entry.summary: I explain what kinds of correlation or even direct classical communication between detectors invalidate Bell's theorem, and what kinds do not.

entry.title: Comment on ``Experimental Simulation of Two-Particle Quantum Entanglement using Classical Fields''
entry.summary: We assert that the reported results consitute an empirical counterexample to Bell's theorem

entry.title: Comments on Struyve and Baere's paper on experiments to distinguish Bohmian mechanics from quantum mechanics
entry.summary: It is shown in detail why the arguments put forward by Struyve and Baere (quant-ph/0108038) against my conclusions are incorrect.

entry.title: Complex worlds from simple rules?
entry.summary: Can the apparent complexity we observe in the real world be generated from simple initial conditions via simple, deterministic rules?

entry.title: Comment on ``Quantum noise influencing human behaviour could fake effectiveness of drugs in clinical trials''
entry.summary: Here are discussed some problems concerning quant-ph/0208006.

entry.title: On Questions of Non-Locality in our EPR model
entry.summary: The Einstein-locality of our EPR model has been questioned. We show that our model obeys Einstein locality and that the questions are without basis.

entry.title: $so(2,1)$ scattering via Euclidean Connection for the Natanzon Hypergeometric Potentials
entry.summary: The $so(2,1)$ Euclidean Connection formalism is used to calculate the $S$ matrix for the Hypergeometric Natanzon Potentials ($HNP$).

entry.title: Proposing a new approach to implementing Fuzzy Systems
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn.

entry.title: The four-qubit singlet state and decoherence-free subspaces
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author.

entry.title: A revised de Broglie relation in discrete space-time
entry.summary: We introduce a revised de Broglie relation in discrete space-time, and analyze some possible inferences of the relation.

entry.title: Degree of entanglement for bipartite pure states
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn.

entry.title: On Solvable Potentials for One Dimensional Schroedinger and Fokker-Planck Equations
entry.summary: One construction of exactly-solvable potentials for Fokker-Planck equation is considered based on supersymmetric quantum mechanics approach.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, submitted to J.Phys.A.:Math and Gen

entry.title: Describing the Patterns of Nature: Information and the Structure of Physical Theories
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the author

entry.title: Does decoherence in the thermodynamic limit exist?
entry.summary: Paper withdrawn due to an error into the equations of the probability amplitudes.

entry.title: Dirac-Like Equation for Two-Level Atom
entry.summary: We construct Dirac-like equation for describing two-level atom interacting with resonant laser field.

author.name: V. Ye. Brazovsky

entry.title: Experimental Phase-Sensitive Cloning
entry.summary: This article has been withdrawn.

entry.title: Recent Experiments on the Casimir Effect: Description and Analysis
entry.summary: Contribution to the Seminaire Poincare, 2002
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Poincar\'e Seminar 2002, B.Duplantier & V. Rivasseau eds (Birkh\"auser, 2003) 109-126

entry.title: Noether conservation laws in quantum mechanics
entry.summary: Being quantized, conserved Noether symmetry functions are represented by Hermitian operators in the space of solutions of the Schrodinger equation, and their mean values are conserved.

entry.title: Entanglement Cost of Three-Level Antisymmetric States
entry.summary: We show that the entanglement cost of the three-dimensional antisymmetric states is one ebit.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: J. Phys. A: Math. Gen. 36, L237 (2003).

entry.title: On the Unnikrishnan approach to the notion of locality
entry.summary: Recent proposals by C.S. Unnikrishnan concerning locality and Bell's theorem are critically analysed.

entry.title: A logical interpretation of a delayed-choice, quantum eraser experiment
entry.summary: This paper shows how one can construe the experimental results in a way that does not involve effects that precede their causes.

entry.title: Comment on "Quantum Interferometric Optical Lithography: Exploiting Entanglement to Beat the Diffraction Limit"
entry.summary: Comment on "Quantum Interferometric Optical Lithography: Exploiting Entanglement to Beat the Diffraction Limit" The effective absorption rates in quantum lithography are very low.

entry.title: Degree of entanglement for two qutrits in a pure state
entry.summary: In this paper, a new measure of entanglement for general pure bipartite states of two qutrits is formulated.

entry.title: Parametrization of Quantum States and Channels
entry.summary: In this manuscript, a parametrization of positive matrices together with some of its many applications in quantum information theory is given.

entry.title: A Class of Linear Positive Maps in Matrix Algebras
entry.summary: A class of linear positive, trace preserving maps in $M_n$ is given in terms of affine maps in $\bBR^{n^2-1}$ which map the closed unit ball into itself.

entry.title: Probabilistic foundations of quantum mechanics and quantum information
entry.summary: We discuss foundation of quantum mechanics (interpretations, superposition, principle of complementarity, locality, hidden variables) and quantum information theory.
entry.arxiv:comment: Contextual probabilistic viewpoint to quantum cryptography project

entry.title: Integrable systems as quantum mechanics
entry.summary: This is a mainly expository sketch showing how some integrable systems (e.g. KP or KdV) can be viewed as quantum mechanical in nature.

entry.title: Is negative refraction, perfect focusing compatible with quantum mechanics?
entry.summary: In light of experiments in atom optics, the compatibilty of negative refraction, perfect focusing with quantum mechanics is brought into question.

entry.title: Quantum Public-Key Cryptosystem Based on Classical NP-Complete Problem
entry.summary: We present a quantum public-key cryptosystem based on a classical NP-complete problem related with finding a code word of a given weight in a linear binary code.

entry.title: Entanglement and Time
entry.summary: It is argued that recent experiments testing Multisimultaneity prove that quantum entanglement occurs without the flow of time. Bohm's theory cannot be considered a real temporal description.

entry.title: Robust String Matching in O(\sqrt{N}+M) Quantum Queries
entry.summary: This paper was withdrawn by the author due to a fatal error.

entry.title: Components for Optical Qubits in the Radio Frequency Basis
entry.summary: We describe a scheme for the encoding and manipulation of single photon qubits in radio frequency sideband modes using standard optical elements.

entry.title: Algebras of infinite qubit systems
entry.summary: The input and output algebras of an infinite qubit system and their representations are described.

entry.title: The Dirac Field in Real Domain
entry.summary: The Dirac field is analysed in real domain. A connection with the classical field theory is shown and corresponding relation to the quantum physics.

entry.title: On the Self-Interaction in Theory of Real Dirac Field
entry.summary: Reduction of the self-interaction in the theory of real Dirac field is considered.

entry.title: On the Quadratic Interaction Term in the Real Dirac Field Theory
entry.summary: Effects of the quadratic interaction term in the real Dirac field theory are considered.

entry.title: Växjö interpretation-2003: realism of contexts
entry.summary: We present a new variant of the V\"axj\"o interpretation: contextualistic statistical realistic. Basic ideas of the V\"axj\"o interpretation-2001 are essentially clarified. We also discuss applications to biology, psychology, sociology, economy,...

entry.title: A stochastic limit approach to the SAT problem
entry.summary: We propose a new approach to solve an NP complete problem by means of stochastic limit.

entry.title: Introduction to Quantum Cellular Automata
entry.summary: We provide an introduction to Quantum Cellular Automata.

entry.title: Note on the Dirac Field in Real Domain
entry.summary: Sufficient conditions for linear electrodynamics with real Dirac field are derived.

entry.title: The ping-pong protocol can be attacked without eavesdropping
entry.summary: Attack the ping-pong protocol without eavesdropping.

entry.title: Young's two-slits experiment with people
entry.summary: The two-slits and one-slit experiments with people are performed and show the existence of wave component of women behavior.

entry.title: Supersymmetry and Qubit Field Theory
entry.summary: Supersymmetric extension of the Deutsch's qubit field theory is presented and a new solution of quantum information paradox via anticommuting qubit-fields condensate is shown.

entry.title: Compatibility and probability
entry.summary: A review of various definitions of "compatibility" expressed in terms of ordinary probability, and a discussion of the occurrence of incompatibility (and the related phenomenon of interference) in non-quantal probabilistic systems.

entry.title: Quantum recurrences versus stability
entry.summary: Consequences of quantum recurrences on the stability of a broad class of dynamical systems is presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: to appear in Physics Lett. A

entry.title: Nondeterministic Recursion with Quantum Units (I-V)
entry.summary: In this paper are discussed some formal properties of quantum devices necessary for implementation of nondeterministic Turing machine.

entry.title: Deterministic Secure Direct Bidirectional Communication Protocol
entry.summary: In this letter a deterministic secure direct bidirectional communication protocol is proposed by using the quantum entanglement and local unitary operations on one photon of the Einstein-Podolsky-Rosen (EPR) photon pair.

entry.title: Adiabatic Evolution in XXX Spin Chain is Fast
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn.

entry.title: Comment on "Quantum dense key distribution"
entry.summary: In this Comment we question the security of recently proposed by Degiovanni et al. [Phys. Rev. A 69 (2004) 032310] scheme of quantum dense key distribution.

entry.title: The Evolution Operator of The Three Atoms Tavis-Cummings Model
entry.summary: The explicit form of evolution operator of the three atoms Tavis-Cummings Model is given.

entry.title: Fisher, Kaehler, Weyl and the quantum potential
entry.summary: Connections between Fisher information, Kaehler geometry of a quantum projective Hilbert space, and the Weyl-Ricci scalar curvature of a Riemannian flat spacetime with quantum matter are sketched.

entry.title: Statistically Secure Quantum Oblivious Transfer
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn.

entry.title: Decoherence of Anyon Qubit
entry.summary: One mechanism of decoherence of anyon qubit due to interaction with edge states is considered. The calculations are made at low temperature in Markovian and "short-time" approximation. Two approximations are compared.

entry.title: Universal Quantum Filter
entry.summary: Universal quantum filter (UQF) is introduced and proved to exist. Optical realization of UQF is proposed in experiment.

entry.title: Classical Physics revisited: Derivation and explanation of the quantum mechanical superposition principle and Born's rule
entry.summary: The paper is withdrawn due to an error in Section 2.

entry.title: Quantum probability applied to the damped harmonic oscillator
entry.summary: In this introductory course we sketch the framework of quantum probability in order to discuss open quantum systems, in particular the damped harmonic oscillator.

entry.title: The Interpretation of Quantum Mechanics
entry.summary: In this paper, we demonstrate how the interpretation of quantum mechanics due to Land\'e resolves the Schr\"odinger cat paradox and disposes of the problem of wave function collapse.

entry.title: An Elementary Proof of the Quantum Adiabatic Theorem
entry.summary: We provide an elementary proof of the quantum adiabatic theorem.

entry.title: On the Complementarity Principle
entry.summary: We present a scheme in which we investigate the two-slit experiment and the the principle of complementarity.

entry.title: Comments on "Evidence for Quantized Displacement in Macroscopic Nanomechanical Oscillators"
entry.summary: We make comments on Gaidarzhy {\it et al.}'s [{\it Phys. Rev. Lett.} 94, 030402 (2005)] letter.

entry.title: A role of topology and quantum information in physics
entry.summary: The role of topology in QIS with physical connection to the noncommutativity, discretization,supersymmetry, entanglement, nonseparability and CP violation in physics is discussed.

entry.title: On the role of Planck's oscillator in the construction of Heisenberg's mechanics
entry.summary: In the present note we elucidate how physical considerations based on Planck's oscillator led to the construction of Heisenberg's mechanics.

entry.title: Withdrawn
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn.

entry.title: Decoherence in non integrable systems
entry.summary: Self-induced decoherence formalism and the corresponding classical limit are extended from quantum integrable systems to non-integrable ones.

entry.title: From quantum graphs to quantum random walks
entry.summary: We give a short overview over recent developments on quantum graphs and outline the connection between general quantum graphs and so-called quantum random walks.

entry.title: Comment on "Teleportation with a uniformly accelerated partner"
entry.summary: We comment on the paper "Teleportation with a uniformly accelerated partner" (quant-ph/0302179).

entry.title: Conditionalizing and commutativity: a note on Malley
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn.

entry.title: Distinguishing sets of quantum states
entry.summary: Given two sets finite $S_0$ and $S_1$ of quantum states. We show necessary and sufficient conditions for distinguishing them by a measurement.

entry.title: Entanglement in thermal equilibrium states
entry.summary: We revisist the issue of entanglement of thermal equilibrium states in composite quantum systems. The possible scenarios are exemplified in bipartite qubit/qubit and qubit/qutrit systems.

entry.title: Deterministic cloning of an unknown Bell state
entry.summary: Recently Gupta and Panigrahi have shown how to deterministically identify an unknown Bell state. The present paper extends their result to deterministic cloning.

entry.title: Distributing a multiparticle state by entanglement swapping
entry.summary: Using entanglement swapping, we construct a scheme to distribute an arbitrary multiparticle state to remote receivers. Only Bell states and two-qubit collective measurements are required.

entry.title: Reply to Brankov et al.'s "Comment on equivalence between quantum phase transition phenomena in radiation-matter and magnetic systems"
entry.summary: Reply to Comment quant-ph/0506207 by J.G.Brankov et al.

entry.title: On decaying rate of a quantum state
entry.summary: Decaying rate of a quantum system investigated using the Fubini-Study definition of distance between states.

entry.title: New Scheme of Quantum Teleportation
entry.summary: A new scheme for quantum teleportation is presented, in which the complete teleportation can be occurred even when an entangled state between Alice and Bob is not maximal.

entry.title: Impact of entanglement on the game-theoretical concept of evolutionary stability
entry.summary: An example of a quantum game is presented that explicitly shows the impact of entanglement on the game-theoretical concept of evolutionary stability.

entry.title: Comment on "Quantum Physics from A to Z"
entry.summary: This is a comment on a collection of statements gathered on the occasion of the Quantum Physics of Nature meeting in Vienna.
entry.arxiv:comment: A comment on quant-ph/0505187 v4, 8 pages, LaTeX

entry.title: Implications of the Luders Postulate for Quantum Algorithms
entry.summary: The Luders postulate is reviewed and implications for quantum algorithms are discussed. A search algorithm for an unstructured database is described.

entry.title: Quantum Measurements for Graph Isomorphism Require Entanglement: Tight Results on Multiregister Fourier Sampling (Withdrawn)
entry.summary: This article has been withdrawn by the authors.

entry.title: Comment on "Topological Transitions in Berry's Phase Interference Effects"
entry.summary: Comment on "Topological Transitions in Berry's Phase Interference Effects"

entry.title: Evolving Quantum Circuits using Genetic Algorithms
entry.summary: The article is taken out.

entry.title: A Dual Observer Information Exchange Theory of Measurement of Quantum Mechanics
entry.summary: The article is taken out.

entry.title: A Study on the basics of Quantum Computing
entry.summary: The article is taken out.

entry.title: A Simple Path Integration For the Time Dependent Oscillator
entry.summary: Feynman propagator is calculated for the time dependent harmonic oscillator by converting the problem into a free particle motion

entry.title: About what can be honestly called a Quantum Brudno's Theorem
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn.

entry.title: A Simple Discussion on Wave Functional in Free QED
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to some mistakes

entry.title: Dynamical Consequences of Strong Entanglement
entry.summary: This review analyzes and compares two consequences of strong decoherence: The quantum Zeno effect and macroscopic motion described by master equations.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages - Contribution to the Seminaire Poincare (Paris, November 2005)

entry.title: Deriving Landauer's erasure principle from statistical mechanics
entry.summary: We present a concise derivation of Landauer's erasure principle from the postulates of statistical mechanics, along with a small number of additional but uncontroversial axioms.

entry.title: Decoherence according to Environment and Self Induced Decoherences
entry.summary: A generalized decoherence formalism that can be used both in open (using Environment Induced Decoherence-EID) and closed (using Self Induced Decoherence-SID) quantum systems is sketched

entry.title: Husimi distribution function and one-dimensional Ising model
entry.summary: Husimi distribution function for the one-dimensional Ising model is obtained. One-point and joint distribution functions are calculated and their thermal behaviour are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, accepted for publication in CJP

entry.title: Elementary quantum cloning machines
entry.summary: The task of reception of a copy of an arbitrary quantum state with use of a minimum quantity of quantum operations is considered.

entry.title: A reply to P W Shor
entry.summary: Two additional reasons are suggested for the seeming lack of progress in producing quantum algorithms.

entry.title: The certainty principle II: Proof of the uncertainty principle
entry.summary: A more detailed derivation of the Heisenberg uncertainty principle from the certainty principle is given.
entry.arxiv:comment: One paper, in Russian and in English, no figures

entry.title: The equilibrium limit of the Casati-Prosen model
entry.summary: An alternative explanation of the decoherence in the Casati-Prosen model is presented. It is based on the Self Induced Decoherence formalism extended to non-integrable systems.

entry.title: Deutsch and Jozsa's Algorithm Revisited
entry.summary: A classical analogue of Deutsch and Jozsa's algorithm is given and its implications on quantum computing is discussed

entry.title: The Yukawa Lagrangian Density is Inconsistent with the Hamiltonian
entry.summary: It is proved that no Hamiltonian exists for the real Klein-Gordon field used in the Yukawa interaction. The experimental side supports this conclusion.

entry.title: The security proof of the ping-pong protocol is wrong
entry.summary: The security proof of the ping-pong protocol is wrong.
entry.arxiv:comment: Any suggestion or comment is welcome!!

entry.title: Decoherence and reduction
entry.summary: A reduction mechanism resulting directly from the basic principles of quantum mechanics is proposed, inseparably from decoherence. A rather consistent theory of this effect is given and the next problems it raises are indicated.

entry.title: Generalized Continuous Variables Quantum Key Distribution
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to the incorrect argument for the security.

entry.title: The Role of Detector in Which-Way Experiment
entry.summary: I will replace this manuscript by a new paper

entry.title: What is paradoxical about the "Three-box paradox"?
entry.summary: This paper is a comment on quant-ph/0606067 by Ravon and Vaidman, in which they defend the position that the ``three-box paradox'' is indeed paradoxical.

entry.title: On Entangled Multiparticle Systems in Bohmian Theory
entry.summary: Arguments are presented to show that the Bohmianian programme cannot be implemented for entangled multiparticle systems in general, analogous to the case of many-particle systems in classical mechanics. We give two examples.

entry.title: Deformed Geometric Algebra and Supersymmetric Quantum Mechanics
entry.summary: Deforming the algebraic structure of geometric algebra on the phase space with a Moyal product leads naturally to supersymmetric quantum mechanics in the star product formalism.

entry.title: Photon wave function and position eigenvectors
entry.summary: One and two photon wave functions are obtained by projection onto a basis of simultaneous eigenvectors of the position and number operators.

entry.title: On Adler's "Conway-Kochen Twin Argument"
entry.summary: We respond to Stephen Adler's comments on our paper "The Free Will Theorem",and add some further observations.

entry.title: Comment on ``Experimental realization of Wheeler's delayed-choice GedankenExperiment''
entry.summary: A shortcoming in the authors' interpretation of this beautiful new experiment is pointed out and briefly discussed.

entry.title: Security verification for continuous variable quantum key distribution
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author

entry.title: Reply to Yang et al.'s comment
entry.summary: This is to reply to a recent comment by Yang, Yuan and Zhang on ``Teleportation of two-quNit entanglement: Exploiting local resorces''.

entry.title: A Re-evaluation of Shor's Algorithm
entry.summary: Shor's algorithm is examined critically from the standpoint of it's eventual use to obtain the factors of large integers.

entry.title: Comments on quant-ph/0609176
entry.summary: In this note, we show the mistake which has been made in quant-ph/0609176. Further more, we provide a sketch of proof to show the impossibility of the effort of such kind toward improving the efficiency of Grover's Algorithm.

entry.title: Spontaneous emission of graviton by a quantum bouncer
entry.summary: Spontaneous emission of graviton rates for the quantum bouncer states are evaluated.

entry.title: A bird's eye view of quantum computers
entry.summary: Quantum computers are discussed in the general framework of computation, the laws of physics and the foundations of quantum mechanics.

entry.title: Comment on: Disproof of Bell's Theorem by Clifford Algebra Valued Local Variables
entry.summary: We ''save'' Bell's Theorem by showing a flaw in Christian's argument.

entry.title: Supersymmetry and quantum games
entry.summary: In this paper we show the connection between the supersymmetry and quantum games.

entry.title: Quantum State Transfer with Spin Chains
entry.summary: The thesis covers various aspects of quantum state transfer in permanently coupled spin systems.
entry.arxiv:comment: PhD thesis, December 2006, University College London, 142 pages

entry.title: Note on Schmidt Decomposition in Infinite Dimensional Hilbert Spaces
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author.

entry.title: On Infinite EPR-like Correlations
entry.summary: The paper investigates, in the framework of branching space-times, whether an infinite EPR-like correlation which does not involve finite EPR-like correlations is possible.

entry.title: Simple Model of Particle Detector and Arrival Time
entry.summary: We present the very simple model of a particle detector and the proposal for the calculation of the average value of the time of arrival.

entry.title: Entanglement of a class of mixed two - qutrit states
entry.summary: We compute the measure of entanglement for some classes of states belonging to the simplex of Bell - diagonal states of two qutrits.

entry.title: SIC-POVMs exist in all dimensions
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to mathematical errors.

entry.title: Detection of fidelity and multiparticle entanglement for arbitrary graph states
entry.summary: withdrawn by the authors because of an error.
entry.arxiv:comment: withdrawn by the authors because of an error

entry.title: The Aharonov-Casher effect
entry.summary: The Aharonov-Casher effect, entry in the Compendium of Quantum Physics: Concepts, Experiments, History and Philosophy, ed. F. Weinert, K. Hentschel, D. Greenberger and B. Falkenburg (Springer), to appear

entry.title: Berry's phase
entry.summary: Berry's phase, entry in the Compendium of Quantum Physics: Concepts, Experiments, History and Philosophy, ed. F. Weinert, K. Hentschel, D. Greenberger and B. Falkenburg (Springer), to appear

entry.title: Errors and paradoxes in quantum mechanics
entry.summary: Errors and paradoxes in quantum mechanics, entry in the Compendium of Quantum Physics: Concepts, Experiments, History and Philosophy, ed. F. Weinert, K. Hentschel, D. Greenberger and B. Falkenburg (Springer), to appear

entry.title: Counterfactuals in Quantum Mechanics
entry.summary: A review of the term "counterfactuals" in various contexts of quantum mechanics.
entry.arxiv:comment: An entry in the Compendium of Quantum Physics: Concepts, Experiments, History and Philosophy, ed. F. Weinert, K. Hentschel, D. Greenberger and B. Falkenburg

entry.title: Quantum Entanglement in Some Physical Systems
entry.summary: The summary of the Author's results on Bell inequalities and macroscopic entanglement.
entry.arxiv:comment: University of Gdansk, Ph. D. thesis, defended on 20.09.2007

entry.title: Response to Nauenberg's "Critique of Quantum Enigma: Physics Encounters Consciousness"
entry.summary: Nauenberg's extended critique of Quantum Enigma rests on fundamental misunderstandings.
entry.arxiv:comment: To be published in Foundations of Physics

entry.title: Thou Shalt Not Clone One Bit!
entry.summary: We prove a no-triplets theorem for spin 1 particles, which implies a strengthened form of the no-cloning theorem.

entry.title: Quantum interference phenomena in four-wave mixing processes in a cavity driven by quantized fields
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to some problems.

entry.title: Effective generation of entangled states and realization of quantum gate operations in cavity QED
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to some problems.

entry.title: Atomistic and orthoatomistic effect algebras
entry.summary: We characterize atomistic effect algebras, prove that a weakly orthocomplete Archimedean atomic effect algebra is orthoatomistic and present an example of an orthoatomistic orthomodular poset that is not weakly orthocomplete.

entry.title: On completely positive non-Markovian evolution of a d-level system
entry.summary: A sufficient condition for non-Markovian master equation which ensures the complete positivity of the resulting time evolution is presented.

entry.title: Equivalent approaches to electromagnetic field quantization in a linear dielectric
entry.summary: It is shown that the minimal coupling method is equivalent to the Huttner-Barnet and phenomenological approaches up to a canonical transformation.

entry.title: Generating entangled light with atomic ensembles
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to some problems.

entry.title: Comment on "Typicality for Generalized Microcanonical Ensemble"
entry.summary: The validity of the so-called "typicality" argument for a generalised microcanonical ensemble proposed recently is examined.

entry.title: Channel and carrier adapted quantum error correction
entry.summary: The paper has been withdrawn by the autors. The proposed code is not working because orthogonality.

entry.title: Microphysical analogues of flyby anomalies
entry.summary: We discuss Doppler shift and interferometric measurements in analogy to the recently reported macroscopic flyby anomalies.

entry.title: Constructive physics
entry.summary: Discussion of the necessity to use the constructive mathematics as the formalism of quantum theory for systems with many particles.

entry.title: Reconsidering Mermin's "In praise of measurement"
entry.summary: We critically analyze a recent paper by D. Mermin and we compare his statements with Bell's position on the problems he is discussing.

entry.title: Multiple Nash-equilibrium in Quantum Game
entry.summary: Methods of exploring Nash equilibrium in quantum games are studied. Analytical conditions of the existence, the uniqueness or the multiplicity of the equilibria are found.

entry.title: Embedding quantum and random optics in a larger field theory
entry.summary: Introducing creation and annihilation operators for negative frequency components extends the algebra of smeared local observables of quantum optics to include an associated classical random field optics.

entry.title: Efficient and robust adiabatic universal quantum computation using STIRAP on a qubit chain
entry.summary: It is shown that efficient and robust universal quantum computation is possible using the stimulated Raman adiabatic passage with a qubit chain as a pointer register.

entry.title: On a New Form of Quantum Mechanics
entry.summary: We propose a new form of nonrelativistic quantum mechanics which is based on a quantum version of the action principle.

entry.title: On Conway and Kochen's "Thou shalt not clone one bit!"
entry.summary: A physicists' explanation of why thou shalt not clone one bit gives a stronger version of Conway and Kochen's theorem.

entry.title: On the absence of a measurement problem in quantum computer science
entry.summary: I comment on GianCarlo Ghirardi's criticism of my claim that quantum computation has no measurement problem.

entry.title: On a Quantum Action Principle
entry.summary: A quantum version of the action principle is formulated in terms of real parameters of a wave functional. The classical limit of the quantum action of a harmonic oscillator is obtained.

entry.title: A Non-Renormalized Field Theoretic Treatment of Photon Scattering
entry.summary: NA

entry.title: Quantum Action Principle in Relativistic Mechanics
entry.summary: A quantum version of the action principle is considered in the case of a free relativistic particle. The classical limit of the quantum action is obtained.

entry.title: Robust entangled states
entry.summary: We establish a technique to find the states with most robust entanglement in dissipative quantum systems and explicitly construct those state for various environments.

entry.title: Weak Value and Correlation Function
entry.summary: We show that there exists, in quantum theory, a close relationship between the weak value and the correlation function, which sheds new lights on the concept of the weak value.

entry.title: Positional decoherence
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author because overcame by arXiv:0910.4694
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the author because overcame by arXiv:0910.4694

entry.title: On the structure of generators for non-Markovian Master Equations
entry.summary: Complete characterization of complete positivity preserving non-Markovian master equations is presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: accepted in Open Sys. Information Dyn

entry.title: Strong causality from weak via continuous monitoring
entry.summary: Repeated unbiased measurements cause a continual application of the weak causality principle, leading to an apparent arrow of time for continuously-monitored quantum systems.

entry.title: Interaction-assisted SU(2) adiabatic holonomies in Josephson phase qubits
entry.summary: We propose a scheme for generating SU(2) adiabatic geometric phases in a circuit consisting of three capacitively coupled flux-biased Josephson phase qubits.

entry.title: Has the Born rule been proven?
entry.summary: This note is a somewhat-lighthearted comment on a recent paper by David Wallace, arXiv:0906.2718[quant-ph] entitled "A formal proof of the Born rule from decision-theoretic assumptions".

entry.title: Blackbody radiation drag on a relativistically moving mirror
entry.summary: We compute the drag force on a mirror moving at relativistic velocity relative to blackbody radiation background.
entry.arxiv:comment: an exact solution of relativistic photon drag problem

entry.title: Entanglement criterion based on skew information
entry.summary: we can establish an entanglement criteria from skew information. our criterion is independent of Local Uncertainty Relations.

entry.title: Efficient, scalable generation of cluster states in charge qubits
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author because it was a speculative investigation.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the author

entry.title: To Quantization of Free Electromagnetic Field
entry.summary: Correct quantization of free electromagnetic field is proposed

entry.title: Quantum communication using quantum game theory
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author(s), due to some technical problem.

entry.title: Reply to Comment on "Non Hermitian Quantum Mechanics with Minimal Length Uncertainty", arXiv:0908.2341
entry.summary: It is shown that the results of ref [1] are consistent.

entry.title: Energy and Eigenstate Using First Order Perturbation Theory
entry.summary: The first order estimate of energy and eigenstate of a perturbed system are found by summation over its basis.

entry.title: Time Eigenvalues for the One-dimensional Infinite Square Well
entry.summary: Discrete time eigenvalues are found for the Infinite Square Well.

entry.title: On the linear dispersion--linear potential quantum oscillator
entry.summary: We solve the bi-linear quantum oscillator H=v|p|+F|x| both quasi-classically and numerically.

entry.title: Suppressing local enviromental noise in non clasical communication
entry.summary: We have modified the work
