entry.title: The relativistic massless harmonic oscillator
entry.summary: A detailed study of the relativistic classical and quantum mechanics of the massless harmonic oscillator is presented.

entry.title: A new bound of concurrence
entry.summary: We give a new bound of concurrence.
entry.arxiv:comment: I find this result can be easily get from my previous paper.

entry.title: Reality and locality in quantum mechanics, an experiment proposed
entry.summary: A view of emission and absorption of photons by atoms, which was proposed by Max Planck, is recalled. A direct experiment that could corroborate or refute that view is defined.

entry.title: Quantum Measurements Cannot be Proved to be Random
entry.summary: We show that it is impossible to prove that the outcome of a quantum measurement is random.

entry.title: Local unitary equivalence and distinguishability of arbitrary multipartite pure states
entry.summary: We give an universal algorithm for testing the local unitary equivalence of states for multipartite system with arbitrary dimensions.

entry.title: Comment on "Semiquantum-key distribution using less than four quantum states"
entry.summary: Comment on Phys. Rev. A 79, 052312 (2009), http://pra.aps.org/abstract/PRA/v79/i5/e052312

entry.title: Indeterminisme Quantique et Impredictibilite Classique
entry.summary: We present in an informal way some recent results concerning a possible overlapping between classical unpredictability and quantum indeterminism.

entry.title: Nonlocality and quantum mechanics
entry.summary: A class of nonlocal hidden variable theories is shown to be incompatible with quantum mechanics.

entry.title: Erratum: Dynamics of the Bounds of Squared Concurrence [Phys. Rev. A 79, 032306 (2009)]
entry.summary: This is an erratum to our paper.
entry.arxiv:comment: a little different from the published version

entry.title: Time-dependent Schrödinger equation from the Hamilton-Jacobi equation
entry.summary: This paper and abstract have been withdrawn.

entry.title: The discrete-time Grover walk on star graphs with one loop
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author because the result of this paper was already obtained.

entry.title: How much contextuality?
entry.summary: The amount of contextuality is quantified in terms of the probability of the necessary violations of noncontextual assignments to counterfactual elements of physical reality.

entry.title: Criteria For $K$-Separability Of Multipartite Quantum State
entry.summary: We derive criteria for $k$-separability of multipartite Quantum state

entry.title: Optimal entanglement witnesses for two qutrits
entry.summary: We provide a proof that entanglement witnesses considered recently in [D. Chru\'sci\'nski, F.A. Wudarski, arXiv:1105.4821] are optimal.

entry.title: Quantum correlations in the thermodynamic limit: the XY-model
entry.summary: We investigate thermal properties of quantum correlations in the thermodynamic limit with reference to the XY-model

entry.title: Adversary lower bounds in the Hamiltonian oracle model
entry.summary: In this note, we show that quantum lower bounds obtained using the adversary method hold in the Hamiltonian oracle model.

entry.title: Quantum Walk of Nonclassical Light in Glauber-Fock photonic lattices
entry.summary: The paper is being updated.

entry.title: On Minimum Uncertainty States
entry.summary: Necessary and sufficient condition for the existence of a minimum uncertainty state for an arbitrary pair of observables is given.

entry.title: Useless Qubits in "Relativistic Quantum Information"
entry.summary: I draw attention to previous work that shows that the observables corresponding to relativistic quantum field modes commonly employed in papers on "relativistic quantum information" cannot be measured by ideal measurements.

entry.title: Information Causality
entry.summary: We review the literature on Information Causality. Since it's for a book, we don't think an abstract will be needed at all, so we have written this one just for the sake of the arXiv.

entry.title: Mini-Proceedings ECT*: Speakable in quantum mechanics: atomic, nuclear and subnuclear physics tests
entry.summary: Mini-Proceedings ECT*: Speakable in quantum mechanics: atomic, nuclear and subnuclear physics tests, ECT*-Trento, 29 August - 2 September, 2011

entry.title: On "Law without Law"
entry.summary: A quantum mechanism for logogenesis is conjectured.

entry.title: Convex Geometry: a travel to the limits of our knowledge
entry.summary: Our knowledge and ignorance concerning the geometry of quantum states are discussed.

entry.title: Adversary Lower Bound for Element Distinctness
entry.summary: In this note we construct an explicit optimal (negative-weight) adversary matrix for the element distinctness problem, given that the size of the alphabet is sufficiently large.

entry.title: "Einstein's Dream" - Quantum Mechanics as Theory of Classical Random Fields
entry.summary: This is an introductory chapter of the book in progress on quantum foundations and incompleteness of quantum mechanics. Quantum mechanics is represented as statistical mechanics of classical fields.

entry.title: Relative momentum for identical particles
entry.summary: Possible definitions for the relative momentum of identical particles are considered.

entry.title: A quantitative aspect of the Heisenberg uncertainty
entry.summary: Minimization of the expectation value of energy under the constraints imposed by the uncertainty principle can be a convenient method of solving quantum-mechanical problems.

entry.title: Stern-Gerlach Experiments and Complex Numbers in Quantum Physics
entry.summary: It is often stated that complex numbers are essential in quantum theory. In this article, the need for complex numbers in quantum theory is motivated using the results of tandem Stern-Gerlach experiments

entry.title: On deformed quantum potentials
entry.summary: We describe some analogues of quantum potentials arising in fractional or deformed Schroedinger equations.

entry.title: An Unconditionally Secure Quantum Bit Commitment Protocol
entry.summary: This article describes a quantum bit commitment protocol, QBC1, based on entanglement destruction via forced measurements and proves its unconditional security.

entry.title: Spin currents in non-inertial frames
entry.summary: The covariant Dirac equation and its solutions show that rotation and acceleration can be used to generate and control spin currents.

entry.title: Towards Efficient Computation of Functional Determinants in QM and QFT
entry.summary: We present an overview of the existing methods for computing functional determinants, and outline a possible way forward for Hamiltonians of higher dimensions without radial symmetry.

entry.title: Nonexistence of Quantum Nonlocality
entry.summary: What violations of Bell inequalities teach us is that the world is quantum mechanical, i.e., nonclassical. Assertions that they imply the world is nonlocal arise from ignoring differences between quantum and classical physics.

entry.title: On a recent experiment seemingly violating quantum predictions
entry.summary: A disagreement of the empirical results with quantum mechanical predictions is pointed out in the experiment by M. Giustina et al. [arXiv:1212.0533].

entry.title: A Note on Entanglement, Nonlocality, and Superluminal Signaling
entry.summary: An alternative approach to "entanglement, nonlocality, and superluminal signaling" is advocated. It is inspired on Faraday's way of viewing physics.

entry.title: An indicator energy of two close levels
entry.summary: In this paper, we introduce a concept of an indicator energy of two close levels in the perturbation.

entry.title: Hybrid paramagnetic-ferromagnetic quantum computer design based on electron spin arrays and a ferromagnetic nanostripe
entry.summary: General design for the practical implementation of hybrid paramagnetic-ferromagnetic quantum computer.

entry.title: Comment on "Weak value amplification is suboptimal for estimation and detection"
entry.summary: The assumptions of Ferrie and Combes are irrelevant for realistic experimental situations. This undermines their conclusions.

entry.title: A comment on "Weak value amplification is suboptimal for estimation and detection"
entry.summary: By assuming that the weak value is real, Ferrie and Combes render their result inapplicable to weak measurement experiments which are aimed at enhancing precision.

entry.title: QBism in the New Scientist
entry.summary: I correct a misrepresentation of QBism as antirealist.

entry.title: Comment on "Unconditionally secure commitment in position-based quantum cryptography"
entry.summary: We show that a recently proposed relativistic commitment scheme [Sci. Rep. 4, 6774 (2014). arXiv:1406.6679] is insecure against the cheating of the committer.

entry.title: Comments on a recent proposal of superluminal communication
entry.summary: We analyze critically a recent proposal of faster than light communication.

entry.title: Shortly on Genuine Significance of Uncertainty Relations
entry.summary: It brings into attention briefly the genuine significance of uncertainty relations and of their extrapolations for which conventional(usual) doctrine promotes unjustified ideas.

entry.title: Weak amplification and single-photon weak-coupling optomechanics
entry.summary: The meaning and its possible applications of post-selected weak amplification in optomechanical system is concisely reviewed.

entry.title: A classical paradox of choice
entry.summary: A classical analogue of the Adlam-Kent "Quantum paradox of choice" (arXiv:1509.04226) is presented.

entry.title: Nonlocality in quantum theory
entry.summary: This article describes a proposed way to conduct an experiment using a correlated particle pair in an entangled state, which leaves no room for any local models.

entry.title: A short note on extended probability theory
entry.summary: We propose two distinct interpretations of extended probabilities which are realistic for the physical world.

entry.title: Comment on Griffiths about locality, realism and Bell experiments
entry.summary: I argue that quantum mechanics is a realistic theory, but it violates either strong locality (no superluminal influences) or strict causality (diiferent effects cannot follow from the same cause).

entry.title: Getting used to quantum optics
entry.summary: The article reviews how to measure one and the same photon at both output ports of a beam splitter.

entry.title: On the uncomputability of the spectral gap
entry.summary: This paper reviews the 1994 proof that the spectral gap of Hamiltonian quantum systems capable of universal computation is uncomputable.

entry.title: A note on the statistical sampling aspect of delayed choice entanglement swapping
entry.summary: Quantum and classical models for delayed choice entanglement swapping by postselection of measurements are discussed.

entry.title: A method of constructive quantum mechanics of remarkable hidden beauty
entry.summary: A viewpoint-article comment on asymptotic iteration method.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pp for special issue of JPA

entry.title: Sewing Greenberger-Horne-Zeilinger states with a quantum zipper
entry.summary: A mechanism of a chiral spin wave rotation is introduced to systematically generate mesoscopic Greenberger-Horne-Zeilinger states.

entry.title: Restrictions on the Schmidt rank of bipartite unitary operators beyond dimension two
entry.summary: There are none.

entry.title: Quantum propagator from Heisenberg equations
entry.summary: Quantum propagator for a general quadratic Lagrangian is obtained using position and momentum operators in Heisenberg picture and properties of propagators. The method can be generalized to a general quadratic Lagrangian in higher dimensions straightforwardly.

entry.title: A Comment on "Asking photons where they have been in plain language"
entry.summary: The criticism of the experiment showing disconnected traces of photons passing through a nested Mach-Zehnder interferometer is shown to be unfounded.

entry.title: Entanglement through path identification
entry.summary: Entanglement in multipartite systems can be achieved by the coherent superposition of product states, generated through a universal unitary transformation, followed by spontaneous parametric down-conversions and path identification.

entry.title: Teleportation for septuagenarians
entry.summary: An introduction to the theory of teleportation.

entry.title: An even simpler understanding of quantum weak values
entry.summary: We explain the properties and clarify the meaning of quantum weak values using only the basic notions of elementary quantum mechanics.

entry.title: Entropic Approach to Error-Disturbance Tradeoff in Quantum Measurements
entry.summary: We discuss the relation between entropic uncertainty relations by Buscemi et al. and by Barchielli et al.
entry.arxiv:comment: To be published in JPSJ Short Note

entry.title: A slightly smaller surface code S gate
entry.summary: We cut the volume of surface code S gates by 25% by omitting a Hadamard gate.

entry.title: RESOLUTION OF A ``RETRODICTION PARADOX''
entry.summary: It is shown that the ``retrodiction paradox'' recently introduced by Peres arises not because of the fallacy of the time-symmetric approach as he claimed, but due to an inappropriate usage of retrodiction.

entry.title: NONLOCALITY OF A SINGLE PHOTON REVISITED AGAIN
entry.summary: Comment on L. Hardy, Phys. Rev. Lett. {\bf 73}, 2279 (1994). It is argued that the experiment proposed by Hardy should not be considered as a single photon experiment.

entry.title: Selective continuous quantum measurements: Restricted path integrals and wave equations
entry.summary: We discuss both the restricted path integral (RPI) and the wave equation (WE) techniques in the theory of continuous quantum measurements. We intend to make Mensky's fresh review complete by transforming his "effective" WE with complex Hamiltonian into Ito-differential equations.

entry.title: Roentgen term makes dipole approximation more divergent
entry.summary: The Roentgen correction to the dipole interaction term leads to an additional divergency which can be eliminated for infinitely heavy atoms. For M < infinity a probability of emission in a given direction is represented by a divergent integral.

entry.title: Is Mental Process Non-Computable?
entry.summary: It has recently been claimed that certain aspects of mental processing cannot be simulated by computers, even in principle. The argument is examined and a lacuna is identified.

entry.title: Deformation of Partical Distribution Functions due to Q-nonlinearity and Nonstationary Casimir Effect
entry.summary: The geometrical phase is shown to be integral of motion. Deformation of particle distribution function corresponding to nonstationary Casimir effect is expressed in terms of multivariable Hermite polynomials. Correction to Planck distribution due to q--nonlinearity is discussed.

entry.title: Photon Statistics for MUltimode Squeezed Schrödinger Cat States
entry.summary: Particle distributions in squeezed states, even and odd coherent states are given in terms of multivariable Hermite polynomials. The Q--function and Wigner function for nonclassical field states are discussed.

entry.title: Comment on 'Quantum Backreaction on "Classical" Variables'
entry.summary: It is argued that the bracket of Anderson's canonical theory should have been antisymmetric otherwise serious controversies arise like violation of both hermiticity and the Leibniz rule of differentiation.

entry.title: Standard Model plus Gravity from Octonion Creators and Annihilators
entry.summary: Octonion creation and annihilation operators are used to construct the Standard Model plus Gravity. The resulting phenomenological model is the D4-D5-E6 model described in hep-ph/9501252 .

entry.title: Stronger-than-quantum correlations
entry.summary: After an elementary derivation of Bell's inequality, several forms of expectation functions for two-valued observables are discussed. Special emphasis is given to hypothetical stronger-than quantum expectation functions which give rise to a maximal violation of Bell's inequality.

entry.title: HyperDiamond Feynman Checkerboard in 4-dimensional Spacetime
entry.summary: A generalized Feynman Checkerboard model is constructed using a 4-dimensional HyperDiamond lattice. The resulting phenomenological model is the D4-D5-E6 model described in hep-ph/9501252 and quant-ph/9503009.

entry.title: Review of R. Omnes, THE INTERPRETATION OF QUANTUM MECHANICS
entry.summary: Omnes' interpretation of quantum mechanics is summarized, and compared with other consistent-history approaches by Gell-Mann and Hartle, and by Griffiths.

entry.title: Wavelet basis for the Schrödinger equation
entry.summary: The self-similar representation for the Schr\"{o}dinger equation is derived.

author.name: M. V. Altaiski
author.arxiv:affiliation: Centre for Applicable Mathematics and Computer Sciences, B.M. Birla Science Centre

entry.title: Universality in Quantum Computation
entry.summary: We show that in quantum computation almost every gate that operates on two or more bits is a universal gate. We discuss various physical considerations bearing on the proper definition of universality for computational components such as logic gates.

entry.title: Nonlinear Schroedinger Dynamics and Nonlinear Observables
entry.summary: It is is explained why physical consistency requires substituting linear observables by nonlinear ones for quantum systems with nonlinear time evolution of pure states. The exact meaning and the concrete physical interpretation are described in full detail for a special case of the nonlinear Doebner-Goldin equation.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages, LaTeX file, 1 figure in PicTeX

entry.title: Quantum Mechanics, Chaos and the Bohm Theory
entry.summary: The quantum counterpart of the classically chaotic kicked rotor is investigated using Bohm's appraoch to quantum theory.
entry.arxiv:comment: Uses Revtex style, 4 figures, Also can be ftp'd anonymously from ftp://zaphod.phys.port.ac.uk/pub/papers/paper1/

entry.title: Why we don't see the Schrödinger's cat state?
entry.summary: Schr\"odinger's cat puzzle is resolved. The reason why we do not see a macroscopic superposition of states is cleared in the light of Everett's formulation of quantum mechanics.

entry.title: Newtonian Quantum Gravity
entry.summary: Puts forward a complete scenario for interpreting nonlinear field theories highlighting the role played by gravitational self--energy in enabling a consistent revival of the Schroedinger approach to unifying micro and macro physics.
entry.arxiv:comment: 38 pages, RevTex. Uses epsf. Five "tar.gz" compressed PostScipt figures included separately

entry.title: Quantum cryptography based on Wheeler's delayed choice experiment
entry.summary: We describe a cryptographic protocol in which Wheeler's delayed choice experiment is used to generate the key distribution. The protocol, which uses photons polarized only along one axis, is secure against general attacks.

entry.title: Can Future Events Influence the Present?
entry.summary: Widom, Srivastava, and Sassaroli have published [Phys. Lett. A 203, 255 (1995)] a calculation which purports to show that "future events can affect present events". In this note an error in their calculation is identified.

entry.title: Quantum Cryptography with Orthogonal States?
entry.summary: This is a Comment on Phys Rev Lett 75 (1995) 1239, by Goldenberg and Vaidman
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, LaTeX, 1 figure on separate page Final version in Phys Rev Lett 77 (1996) 3264

entry.title: Altered Stats: Two anyons via path integrals for multiply connected spaces
entry.summary: We apply the formalism of path integrals in multiply connected spaces to the problem of two anyons.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, REVTEX, to appear, Phys Lett A

entry.title: Comment on 'Reduced System Dynamics from the N-Body Schrodinger Equation'
entry.summary: We argue that the "reduced wave function", proposed recently [Phys.Rev.Lett. {\bf 75}, 2255 (1995)], contains conditional and restricted information on the reduced system. The concept of "reduced wave function" can thus not represent a relevant alternative to the common reduced dynamics methods.

entry.title: The Real Significance of the Electromagnetic Potentials
entry.summary: The importance of the potential is revealed in a newly discovered effect of the potential. This paper explore the same issue introduced in quant-ph/9506038 from several different aspects including electron optics and relativity. Some people fail to recognize this effect due to a wrong application of gauge invariance.

entry.title: Geometric Quantization from a Coherent State Viewpoint
entry.summary: A fully geometric procedure of quantization that utilizes a natural and necessary metric on phase space is reviewed and briefly related to the goals of the program of geometric quantization.

entry.title: Physics and Consciousness
entry.summary: Some contributions of physics towards the understanding of consciousness are described. As recent relevant models, associative memory neural networks are mentioned. It is shown that consciousness and quantum physics share some properties. Two existing quantum models are discussed.

entry.title: Axiomatic Quantum Theory
entry.summary: A rough overview is given over the most essential structures underlying all working quantum theoretical models as well as axiomatic and algebraic quantum field theory .

entry.title: Born--Infeld theory of Electroweak and Gravitational fields
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn due to submission of subsequent versions as a new preprint

entry.title: Coherent states of quantum non-linear systems
entry.summary: Quantum dynamics of integrable systems is discussed. Localized wave packets generalizing the conventional coherent states of minimal uncertainty are constructed. The wave packet moves along a certain trajectory and does not change its shape for times of order $\frac{1}{\hbar}$.

entry.title: Correlated states and Schrödinger cats
entry.summary: The Schr\"odinger cat male and female states are discussed. The Wigner and Q--functions of generalized correlated light are given. Linear transformator of photon statistics is reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages,Latex,contribution to Shanxi International conference,1995, on "Squeezed States and Uncertainty Relations"

entry.title: Non-linear Quantization of Integrable Classical Systems
entry.summary: It is demonstrated that the so-called "unavoidable quantum anomalies" can be avoided in the farmework of a special non-linear quantization scheme. A simple example is discussed in detail.

entry.title: Polarization in Quantum Computations
entry.summary: We propose a realization of quantum computing using polarized photons. The information is coded in two polarization directions of the photons and two-qubit operations are done using conditional Faraday effect. We investigate the performance of the system as a computing device.

entry.title: On The relation between Superconductivity and Quantum Hall Effect
entry.summary: We introduce a model of superconductivity and discuss its relation to the quantum Hall-effect. This kind of relation is supported by the well known SQUID results. The concept of pure gauge potential as it is involved in various theoretical models concerning solid state effects in magnetic fields is also discussed.

entry.title: On a physical realization of Chern-Simons Theory
entry.summary: The physical content of Chern-Simons-action is discussed and it is shown that this action is proportional to the usual charged matter interaction term in electrodynamics.

entry.title: Is Quantization Geometry?
entry.summary: The metric known to be relevant for standard quantization procedures receives a natural interpretation and its explicit use simultaneously gives both physical and mathematical meaning to a (coherent-state) phase-space path integral, and at the same time establishes a fully satisfactory, geometric procedure of quantization.

entry.title: Error symmetrization in quantum computers
entry.summary: It is possible to reduce some types of quantum computation errors by symmetrizing the quantum state of a redundant array. Various models are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages LaTeX, extended abstract for PhysComp96

entry.title: Is there anything non-classical?
entry.summary: It is argued that quantum logic and quantum probability theory are fascinating mathematical theories but without any relevance to our real world.
entry.arxiv:comment: Introduction and References are rewritten + corrections in Fig. 5, 21 pages, LaTeX, 5 ps-pictures

entry.title: Quantum teleportation circuitry
entry.summary: This paper is withdrawn as it is equivalent to the paper quant-ph/9605035 by Gilles Brassard.

author.name: Samuel L. Braunstein
author.arxiv:affiliation: Universitat Ulm, Abteilung Quantenphysik, Ulm, Germany

entry.arxiv:comment: This paper is withdrawn as it is equivalent to the paper quant-ph/9605035 by Gilles Brassard

entry.title: Comment on Cyclic quantum-evolution dependence on the Hamiltonian and geometric phase
entry.summary: It is shown that the analysis and the main result of the article by L-A. Wu [Phys. Rev. A 53, 2053 (1996)] are completely erroneous.

entry.title: Consistent Histories may be strange, but so is standard Quantum Theory
entry.summary: Interpretational questions that arise in the Consistent Histories formulation of quantum mechanics are illustrated by the familiar example of a beam passing through multiple slits.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, LaTeX, 1 figure drawn by LaTeX

entry.title: Quantum Mechanics as a Classical Theory XIII: The Tunnel Effect
entry.summary: In this continuation paper we will address the problem of tunneling. We will show how to settle this phenomenon within our classical interpretation. It will be shown that, rigorously speaking, there is no tunnel effect at all.

entry.title: Quantum state estimation
entry.summary: New algorithm for quantum state estimation based on the maximum likelihood estimation is proposed. Existing techniques for state reconstruction based on the inversion of measured data are shown to be overestimated since they do not guarantee the positive definiteness of the reconstructed density matrix.

entry.title: Structure and Function
entry.summary: I discuss the role of quantum dynamics in brain and living matter physics. The paper is presented in the form of a letter to Patricia S. Churchland.

author.name: Giuseppe Vitiello
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dipartimento di Fisica, Universita' di Salerno, Italia

entry.arxiv:comment: to appear in Proceed. of the Tucson 1996 Conference "Towards a Science of Consciousness" Latex file

entry.title: Galilean non-invariance of geometric phase
entry.summary: It is shown that geometric phase in non-relativistic quantum mechanics is not Galilean invariant.

entry.title: What is achieved by decoherence?
entry.summary: A short critical review of the concept of decoherence, its consequences, and its possible implications for the interpretation of quantum theory is given.

entry.title: Interaction-Free Measurements
entry.summary: A brief review of interaction-free measurements (IFM) is presented. The IFM is a solution of a quantum puzzle: How to test a bomb which explodes on every test without exploding it? This paper was given in the Oxford conference in honor of Roger Penrose.

entry.title: New features in supersymmetry breakdown in quantum mechanics
entry.summary: The supersymmetric quantum mechanical model based on higher-derivative supercharge operators possessing unbroken supersymmetry and discrete energies below the vacuum state energy is described. As an example harmonic oscillator potential is considered.

entry.title: Moyal Quantization and Group Theory
entry.summary: We deduce a kernel that allows the Moyal quantization of the cylinder (as phase space) by means of the Stratonovich-Weyl correspondence.

entry.title: Is superluminal motion in relativistic Bohm's theory observable?
entry.summary: We show that the problem of superluminal motion in causal, particle interpretation of bosonic fields is not observable at macroscopic distances.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, LaTex, 1 figure available upon request

entry.title: Quantization of Systems with Constraints
entry.summary: New measures for the quantization of systems with constraints are discussed and applied to several examples, in particular, examples of alternative but equivalent formulations of given first-class constraints, as well as a comparison of regular and irregular constraints.
entry.arxiv:comment: 17 pages, LaTeX, no figures, conference proceedings

entry.title: The structure of the quantum mechanical state space and induced superselection rules
entry.summary: The role of superselection rules for the derivation of classical probability within quantum mechanics is investigated and examples of superselection rules induced by the environment are discussed.

entry.title: Coherent and trajectory-coherent states of a damped harmonic oscillator
entry.summary: In this paper we construct the coherent and trajectory-coherent states of a damped harmonic oscillator. We investigate the properties of this states.

entry.title: Measure of Entaglement
entry.summary: The extent to which a given wave function, $\psi$, is entangled is measured by minimizing the norm of $\psi$ minus all possible unentangled functions. This measure is given by the largest eigenvalue of $\psi^\dagger \psi$, considered as an operator. The definition is basis independent.

entry.title: Quantum Reed-Muller Codes
entry.summary: This paper presents a set of quantum Reed-Muller codes which are typically 100 times more effective than existing quantum Reed-Muller codes.

author.name: Lin Zhang
author.arxiv:affiliation: Defence Science and Technology Organisation, Australia

author.name: Ian Fuss
author.arxiv:affiliation: Defence Science and Technology Organisation, Australia

entry.title: Lorentz-covariant stochastic wave function dynamics?
entry.summary: The e-print is completely withdrawn for it was based on a report which was not public. The author seriously apologizes because he was unaware.

entry.title: Synchronizing Quantum Paths of a Universal Quantum Computer
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn, and will be superseded by another submission.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn, and will be superseded by another submission

entry.title: Non-partial Reality
entry.summary: Study on pre- and postselected quantum system indicates that ``product rule'' and ``sum rule'' for elements of reality should be abandoned. We show that this so-called non-partial realism can refute arguments against hidden variables in a unified way, and might save local realism.

entry.title: Quantum mechanics in the noncontractible space
entry.summary: We show that the impact of the fundamental length in quantum mechanics can be studied within the formalism of Berry's geometrical phase with the line broadening as a resulting physical effect.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, LaTeX style; IL NUOVO CIMENTO B, N.B.(1997) in press

entry.title: Quantum phenomena do not violate the principle of locality - a new interpretation with physical consequences -
entry.summary: A new interpretation of nonrelativistic quantum mechanics explains the violation of Bell's inequality by maintaining realism and the principle of locality.

author.name: Gyula Bene
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute for Solid State Physics, Eo"tvo"s University, Budapest

entry.title: On the failure of Bell's theorem
entry.summary: Using a new approach to quantum mechanics we revisit Hardy's proof for Bell's theorem and point out a loophole in it. We also demonstrate on this example that quantum mechanics is a local realistic theory.

author.name: Gyula Bene
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute for Solid State Physics, Eo"tvo"s University, Budapest

entry.title: The Structure of the SWKB Series
entry.summary: The supersymmetric-WKB series is shown to be such that the SWKB quantisation condition has corrections in powers of h^2 only and with explicit overall factors of E. The results also suggest more efficient methods of calculating the corrections.

entry.title: Angular Velocity Operator and Barnett-Pegg Formalism
entry.summary: We define a new operator within Barnett-Pegg formalism for phase angle. The physical predictions for this operator correspond to those expected of an angular velocity operator. Examples studied are particle on a circle with and without magnetic field and quantum harmonic oscillator.

entry.title: Entanglement and Quantum Computation
entry.summary: We argue that entanglement is the essential non-classical ingredient which provides the computational speed-up in quantum algorithms as compared to algorithms based on the processes of classical physics.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages Latex. Appearing in ``Geometric Issues in the Foundations of Science'' ed. S. Huggett et. al. (O.U.P. 1997)

entry.title: Macroscopic Coherence for a Trapped Electron
entry.summary: We investigate the possibility of generating quantum macroscopic coherence phenomena by means of relativistic effects on a trapped electron.

author.name: Stefano Mancini
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dipartimento di Matematica e Fisica, Universita' di Camerino, Italy

author.name: Paolo Tombesi
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dipartimento di Matematica e Fisica, Universita' di Camerino, Italy

entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, RevTex, accepted by Phys. Rev. A

entry.title: Nonlinear Quantum Mechanics and Locality
entry.summary: It is shown that, in order to avoid unacceptable nonlocal effects, the free parameters of the general Doebner-Goldin equation have to be chosen such that this nonlinear Schr\"odinger equation becomes Galilean covariant.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, no figures, also available on http://www.pt.tu-clausthal.de/preprints/asi-tpa/012-97.html

entry.title: Strict Bounds on Franson Inequality
entry.summary: An inequality, recently proposed by Franson [Phys. Rev. A 54, 3808 (1996)] is analyzed and improved. The inequality connects the change of the expectation value of an observable with the uncertainty of this observable. A strict bound on the ratio between these two quantities is obtained.

entry.title: Fidelity for displaced squeezed states and the oscillator semigroup
entry.summary: The fidelity for two displaced squeezed thermal states is computed using the fact that the corresponding density operators belong to the oscillator semigroup.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, REVTEX, no figures, submitted to Journal of Physics A, May 5, 1997

entry.title: SWKB for the Angular Momentum
entry.summary: In this paper we solve the eigenvalue problem of the angular momentum operator by using the supersymmetric semiclassical quantum mechanics (SWKB), and show that it gives the correct quantization already at the leading order.
entry.arxiv:comment: latex, 9 pages, no figures, to be published in Modern Physics Letters B

entry.title: Explanation of the violation of Bell's inequality by maintaining Einstein separability
entry.summary: A new interpretation offers a consistent conceptual basis for nonrelativistic quantum mechanics. The violation of Bell's inequality is explained by maintaining realism, inductive inference and Einstein separability.

author.name: Gyula Bene
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute for Solid State Physics, Eo"tvo"s University, Budapest

entry.title: A Comment on "Semiquantum Chaos"
entry.summary: The identification of the particle creation and distruction operators is discussed.

entry.title: Upper Bounds on the Size of Quantum Codes
entry.summary: Several upper bounds on the size of quantum codes are derived using the linear programming approach. These bounds are strengthened for the linear quantum codes.

entry.title: Quantum privacy and quantum coherence
entry.summary: We derive a simple relation between a quantum channel's capacity to convey coherent (quantum) information and its usefulness for quantum cryptography.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages RevTex; two short comments added 7 October 1997

entry.title: Reply to the comment "quant-ph/9710002"
entry.summary: In the comment, Zanardi and Rasetti argue that several claims in our recent letter (Phys. Rev. Lett. 79, 1953, 1997) are questionable. The reply shows these claims remain true.

author.name: Lu-Ming Duan
author.arxiv:affiliation: University of Science and Technology of China

author.name: Guang-Can Guo
author.arxiv:affiliation: University of Science and Technology of China

entry.title: Application of the Discrete Quantum - Classical System to the Information Transfer
entry.summary: The role and the form of detectors applicable to the quantum information transfer are investigated. The detectors are described within the Event - Enhanced Quantum Theory.
entry.arxiv:comment: 41 Latex pages, submitted to Open Systems & Information Dynamics

entry.title: Sonoluminescence: The Superradiance Paradigm
entry.summary: In this article we explain sonoluminescence from ideas borrowed from superradiance. The model has no free parameters and the predicted energies of quanta agree with experiment. It also hints why noble gases play a pivotal role in the effect.

entry.title: Interpreting the Quantum World
entry.summary: This is an "Essay-Review" of a book with the same title, by Jeffrey Bub (Cambridge University Press, 1997).
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages LaTeX. To appear in "Studies in History and Philosophy of Science"

entry.title: Uhlmann's parallelism in quantum estimation theory
entry.summary: Two important classes of the quantum statistical model, the locally quasi-classical model and the quasi-classical model, are introduced from the estimation theoretical viewpoint, and they are characterized geometrically by the vanishing conditions of the relative phase factor (RPF), implying the close tie between Uhlmann parallel transport and the quantum estimation theory.

entry.title: Lie-Nambu and beyond
entry.summary: Linear quantum mechanics can be regarded as a particular example of a nonlinear Nambu-type theory. Some elements of this approach are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: revtex; an extended version of the talk given at the workshop "Actual problems in quantum mechanics", Peyresq, July, 1997

entry.title: Photon counting sampling of phase space
entry.summary: The recently proposed scheme for direct sampling of the quantum phase space by photon counting is discussed within the Wigner function formalism.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages LaTeX. A contribution to the Proceedings of the Fifth International Wigner Symposium (Wien, 25-29 August 1997)

entry.title: Localization of Quantum States at the Cyclotron Resonance
entry.summary: A new type of localization - localization over the quantum resonance cells - in an intrinsically degenerate system is explored by using the quasienergy eigenstates.

entry.title: Quantum Relational Databases
entry.summary: The approach given by Grover can be generalised to set an upper complexity limit to the basic operations of relational algebra on a quantum computer. Except in special cases where indices can be used on a classical machine, the quantum upper complexity limit is lower than the classical one.

entry.title: Reply to Unruh
entry.summary: William Unruh has suggested (quant-ph/9710032) that a certain counterfactual statement in my recent nonlocality proof should be re-interpreted in a way that would block the proof. I give reason's why that statement should not be re-interpreted.

entry.title: Quantum cloning without signaling
entry.summary: Perfect Quantum Cloning Machines (QCM) would allow to use quantum nonlocality for arbitrary fast signaling. However perfect QCM cannot exist. We derive a bound on the fidelity of QCM compatible with the no-signaling constraint. This bound equals the fidelity of the Bu\v{z}ek-Hillery QCM.

entry.title: Realization of a collective decoding of codeword states
entry.summary: This was also extended from the previous article quant-ph/9705043, especially in a realization of the decoding process.

entry.title: Yet another comment on "Nonlocal character of quantum theory"
entry.summary: There has been considerable discussion of the claim by Stapp [Am. J. Phys. 65, 300 (1997)] that quantum theory is incompatible with locality. In this note I analyze the meaning of some of the statements used in this discussion.

entry.title: Quantum channels showing superadditivity in capacity
entry.summary: This was significantly extended from the previous article quant-ph/9705043,especially in an information theoretic aspect, by adding new results.

entry.title: Quantum Entanglement and the Nonexistence of Superluminal Signals
entry.summary: This paper shows that ordinary quantum mechanics is not consistent with the superluminal transmission of classical information.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages text plus 1 figure, revised 5 March 1998 to include additional remarks and diagrams

entry.title: Solving in the quantum computer every classical NP problem in polynomial time
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to a crucial error in eq.59. I apologize for the inconveniences.

entry.title: First International Conference on Unconventional Models of Computation UMC'98. An Unconventional Review
entry.summary: Review of the First International Conference on Unconventional Models of Computation UMC'98, Auckland, New Zealand, 5-9 January, 1998
entry.arxiv:comment: latex, no figures, to be published in Bulletin of the European Association of Theoretical Computer Sciences

entry.title: Comment on ``Quantum Entanglement and the Nonexistence of Superluminal Signals''
entry.summary: We argue that the claim given in quant-ph/9801014 is untenable. The fallacy in the proof is a misinterpretation of the no-cloning theorem, which does not allow quantum jumps, specifically measurements.

entry.title: On the necessary conditions for the occurrence of the "environment-induced superselection rules"
entry.summary: We briefly summarize the main recently obtained results concerning existence of the (effective) necessary conditions for the occurrence of the "environment-induced superselection rules" (decoherence).

entry.title: Statistics and Quantum Chaos
entry.summary: We use multi-time correlation functions of quantum systems to construct random variables with statistical properties that reflect the degree of complexity of the underlying quantum dynamics.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, LateX, no figures, restructured version

entry.title: Another Comment on ``Quantum Entanglement and Nonexistence of Superluminal Signals''
entry.summary: We argue that the claim given in quant-ph/9801014 remains untenable in the revised version. The fallacy in the proof is a misinterpretation of the no-cloning and teleportation theorems, which do not involve time and reference frames.

entry.title: No-cloning and superluminal signaling
entry.summary: The argument given by M.D. Westmoreland and B. Schumacher in quant-ph/9801014 leading to the purported conclusion that superluminal signaling violates the no-cloning theorem is shown to be incorrect.

entry.title: A short derivation of Feynman formula
entry.summary: The complex exponential weighting of Feynman formalism is seen to happen at the classical level. (Finiteness of) Feynman path integral formula is suspected then to appear as a consistency condition for the existence of certain Dirac measures over functional spaces.

entry.title: Relativistic formulation of quantum state diffusion?
entry.summary: The recently reported relativistic formulation of the well-known non-relativistic quantum state diffusion is seriously mistaken. It predicts, for instance, inconsistent measurement outcomes for the same system when seen by two different inertial observers.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages LaTeX, submitted to J. Phys. A

entry.title: Exact boundary conditions at finite distance for the time-dependent Schrodinger equation
entry.summary: Exact boundary conditions at finite distance for the solutions of the time-dependent Schrodinger equation are derived. A numerical scheme based on Crank-Nicholson method is proposed to illustrate its applicability in several examples.

entry.title: Evanescent Waves are Not Superluminal
entry.summary: It is demonstrated that an electromagnetic pulse, which is made to tunnel trough a barrier, would not be photo-detected before an identical pulse, which travels the same distance in vacuum.

entry.title: 1/N-expansion and nonclassical state generation in higher-order anharmonic oscillators
entry.summary: Paper is withdrawn

entry.title: Quantum Harmonic Sieve: Learning DNF with a Classical Example Oracle
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors due to a problem with *efficiently* predicting the large fourier coefficients. It is being reworked and will be resubmitted in the near future.

entry.title: Implementation of a Quantum Search Algorithm on a Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Quantum Computer
entry.summary: We demonstrate an implementation of a quantum search algorithm on a two qubit NMR quantum computer based on cytosine.

entry.title: Verifiable quantum oblivious transfer protocol based on entangled states
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn, due to possbility of cheating by Alice by sending the state $\mid\uparrow \uparrow>$$

entry.title: Experimental scheme for quantum teleportation of a single-photon packet
entry.summary: Both complete protocol and optical setup for experimental realization of quantum teleportation of unknown single-photon wave packet are proposed.

author.name: S. N. Molotkov
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute of Solid State Physics, Russian Academy of Sciences

entry.title: A Modification of Grover's Algorithm as a Fast Database Search
entry.summary: A modification of Grover's algorithm is proposed, which can be used directly as a fast database search. An explicit two q-bit example is displayed in detail. We discuss the case where the database has multiple entries corresponding to the same target value.

entry.title: Still Baking
entry.summary: We present here a simple proof of the non-existence of a non-periodic invariant point for the quantum baker's map propagator presented in Rubin and Salwen (Annals of Physics, 1998), for Planck's constant h=1/N and N a positive integer.

entry.title: A realistic interpretation for quantum mechanics
entry.summary: We propose a realistic and nonlocal interpretation for quantum mechanics, which requires new mathematical, physical and philosophical foundations for space-time. Our theory violates Bell's inequality. We also discuss the cat paradox.

author.name: Adonai S. Sant'Anna
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dept. of Mathematics, Federal University at Parana

entry.title: An Introduction to Quantum Computers
entry.summary: This is a short introduction to quantum computers, quantum algorithms and quantum error correcting codes. Familiarity with the principles of quantum theory is assumed. Emphasis is put on a concise presentation of the principles avoiding lengthy discussions.

entry.title: Quantum cryptography based on photon ``frequency'' states: example of a possible realization
entry.summary: A quantum cryptosystem is proposed using single-photon states with different frequency spectra as information carriers. A possible experimental implementation of the cryptosystem is discussed.

author.name: S. N. Molotkov
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute of Solid State Physics, Russian Academy of Sciences

entry.title: Quantized Space-Time and Time's Arrow
entry.summary: Motivated by the latest direct detection of time assymetry in Kaon decay at CERN and Fermilab, we suggest a theoretical rationale for this puzzle, in terms of quantized time.

entry.title: A note on quantum black-box complexity of almost all Boolean functions
entry.summary: We show that, for almost all N-variable Boolean functions f, at least N/4-O(\sqrt{N} log N) queries are required to compute f in quantum black-box model with bounded error.

entry.title: Non-equal-time Poisson brackets
entry.summary: The standard definition of the Poisson brackets is generalized to the non-equal-time Poisson brackets. Their relationship to the equal-time Poisson brackets, as well as to the equal- and non-equal-time commutators, is discussed.

entry.title: Locality Is An Unnecessary Assumption of Bell's Theorem
entry.summary: Without imposing the locality condition,it is shown that quantum mechanics cannot reproduce all the predictions of a special stochastic realistic model used in certain spin-correlation experiments.This shows that the so-called locality condition is an unnecessary assumption of Bell's theorem.

entry.title: Is the Statistical Interpretation of Quantum Mechanics Implied by the Correspondence Principle ?
entry.summary: The classical limit of the Schrodinger equation implies the orthodox statistical interpretation for degrees of freedom in finite-dimensional subspaces of the full Hilbert space, but the argument presented does not imply the Born interpretation for degrees of freedom that have a classical counterpart.

entry.title: A simple eavesdropping strategy of BB84 protocol
entry.summary: A simplified eavesdropping-strategy for BB84 protocol in quantum cryptography (refer to quant-ph/9812022) is proposed. This scheme implements by the `indirect copying' technology. Under this scheme, eavesdropper can exactly obtain the exchanged information between the legitimate users without being detected.

entry.title: On binary constructions of quantum codes
entry.summary: Using the notion of generalized weight we improve estimates on the parameters of quantum codes obtained by Steane's construction from binary codes. This yields several new families of quantum codes.

entry.title: Polynomial-Time Solution to the Hidden Subgroup Problem for a Class of non-abelian Groups
entry.summary: We present a family of non-abelian groups for which the hidden subgroup problem can be solved efficiently on a quantum computer.

entry.title: Is an optimal quantum cloner the best choice for local copying in broadcasting entanglement?
entry.summary: The paper is temporarily withdrawn by the authors.

entry.title: Absence of Chaos in Bohmian Dynamics
entry.summary: The Bohm motion for a particle moving on the line in a quantum state that is a superposition of n+1 energy eigenstates is quasiperiodic with n frequencies.

entry.title: Noncomplemetary Wave-Particle Phenomena Revisited
entry.summary: The simultaneous verification of wave and particle property in some recently suggested experiments has been reviewed in the light of Hilbert space formalism. In this respect, the recent analysis of biprism experiment [J. L. Cereceda, Am. J. Phys. 64 (1996) 459] is criticized.

entry.title: Einstein-Podolsky-Rosen Paradox and Antiparticle
entry.summary: The original version of Einstein-Podolsky-Rosen (EPR) paradox is discussed to show the completeness of Quantum Mechanics (QM). The unique solution leads to the wave function of antiparticle unambiguously, which implies the essential conformity between QM and Special Relativity (SR).

entry.title: Green's Function of the Relativistic Coulomb System via Duru-Kleinert Method
entry.summary: In this paper the fixed-energy amplitude (Green's function) of the relativistic Coulomb system is solved by Duru-Kleinert (DK) method. In the course of the calculations we observe an equivalence between the relativistic Coulomb system and a radial oscillator.

entry.title: Quantum Anti-Zeno Effect
entry.summary: We demonstrate that near threshold decay processes may be accelerated by repeated measurements. Examples include near threshold photodetachment of an electron from a negative ion, and spontaneous emission in a cavity close to the cutoff frequency, or in a photon band gap material.

entry.title: Quantum homodyne tomography with a priori constraints
entry.summary: I present a novel algorithm for reconstructing the Wigner function from homodyne statistics. The proposed method, based on maximum-likelihood estimation, is capable of compensating for detection losses in a numerically stable way.

entry.title: Could Grover's quantum algorithm help in searching an actual database?
entry.summary: I investigate whether it would technologically and economically make sense to build database search engines based on Grover's quantum search algorithm. The answer is not fully conclusive but in my judgement rather negative.

entry.title: Collapse Models
entry.summary: This is a review of formalisms and models (nonrelativistic and relativistic) which modify Schrodinger's equation so that it describes wavefunction collapse as a dynamical physical process.
entry.arxiv:comment: 40 pages, to be published in "Open Systems and Measurement in Relativistic Quantum Theory," F. Petruccione and H. P. Breuer eds. (Springer Verlag, 1999)

entry.title: Quantum Triangulation and Violation of Conservation of Trouble
entry.summary: A scheme is described that allows Alice to communicate to Bob where on earth she is, even though she doesn't know herself. The situation described shows how the generalization of a recent result of Gisin and Popescu [quant-ph/9901072] could be useful.

entry.title: Einstein-Podolsky-Rosen paradox and measurement of quantum system
entry.summary: Einstein-Podolsky-Rosen (EPR) paradox is considered in a relation to a measurement of an arbitrary quantum system . It is shown that the EPR paradox always appears in a gedanken experiment with two successively joined measuring devices.

entry.title: Quantum phenomenology and the Continuum Problem
entry.summary: A new approach to quantum mechanics based on independence of the Continuum Hypothesis is proposed. In one-dimensional case, it is shown that the properties of the set of intermediate cardinality coincide with quantum phenomenology.

entry.title: Comment on "Self-Isospectral Periodic Potentials and Supersymmetric Quantum Mechanics"
entry.summary: We show that the formalism of supersymmetric quantum mechanics applied to the solvable elliptic function potentials $V(x) = mj(j+1){sn}^2(x,m)$ produces new exactly solvable one-dimensional periodic potentials.

entry.title: Probability Distributions and Hilbert Spaces: Quantum and Classical Systems
entry.summary: We use the fact that some linear Hamiltonian systems can be considered as ``finite level'' quantum systems, and the description of quantum mechanics in terms of probabilities, to associate probability distributions with this particular class of linear Hamiltonian systems.

entry.title: Inverse problem and Darboux transformations for two-dimensional finite-difference Schredinger equation
entry.summary: A discrete version of the two-dimensional inverse scattering problem is considered. On this basis, algebraic transformations for the two-dimensional finite-difference Schredinger equation are elaborated.

author.name: A. A. Suzko
author.arxiv:affiliation: Joint Institute for Nuclear Research, Dubna, Russia

entry.title: On oscillatorlike developments and further improvements in squeezing
entry.summary: A recent proposal of new sets of squeezed states is seen as a particular case of a general context admitting realistic physical Hamiltonians. Such improvements reveal themselves helpful in the study of associated squeezing effects. Coherence is also considered.

entry.title: Stochastic Wave-function Simulation of Two-time Correlation Functions
entry.summary: We propose an optimized algorithm for the numerical simulation of two-time correlation functions by means of stochastic wave functions. As a first application, we investigate the two-time correlation function of a nonlinear optical parametric oscillator.

entry.title: Nonlocality in Nonlinear Quantum Mechanics
entry.summary: A general method for testing essential nonlocality of nonlinear modifications of quantum mechanics is presented and applied to show the inconsistency of I. Bialynicki-Birula's and J. Mycielski's nonlinear quantum theory.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, LaTeX2e file, 1 figure in PicTeX, misprints corrected

entry.title: The Dynamic Effect of Quantum Decoherence
entry.summary: An effective force induced by spatially depending decoherence is predicted. The phenomenon is illustrated by a simple model of a 1/2-spin particle subjected to distributed unselective measurement of noncommuting spin components.

entry.title: Entanglement measure and distance
entry.summary: Recently a new entanglemenet dilution scheme has been constructed by Lo and Popescu. This paper points out that this result has a deep implication that the entanglement measure for bipartite pure states is independent of the distance between entangled two systems.

entry.title: A protocol to preserve quantum coherence in cavity QED
entry.summary: We consider the problem of quantum decoherence in cavity QED devices and investigate the possibility to preserve a Schroedinger cat as a coherent superposition along the time.

entry.title: Unified Expressions of Physical Fundamental Interactions and Variational Principles Based On The Quantitative Causal Principle
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors because the paper is largely revised and improved.

entry.title: Unsharp measurements and the conceptual problems of Quantum Theory
entry.summary: The paper emphasis the role of unsharpness in the body of Quantum Theory and the relations to the conceptual problems of the Theory. Key words: quantum measurement, unsharpness, effect, positive operator-valued measure

entry.title: Quantum Theory of Probability and Decisions
entry.summary: The probabilistic predictions of quantum theory are conventionally obtained from a special probabilistic axiom. But that is unnecessary because all the practical consequences of such predictions follow from the remaining, non-probabilistic, axioms of quantum theory, together with the non-probabilistic part of classical decision theory.

entry.title: Quantum dynamics of a damped deformed oscillator
entry.summary: The interaction of a quantum deformed oscillator with the environment is studied deriving a master equation whose form strongly depends on the type of deformation.

entry.title: Calculation of the Deflection of Light Ray near the Sun with Quantum-corrected Newton's Gravitation Law
entry.summary: The deflection of light ray passing near the Sun is calculated with quantum-corrected Newton's gravitation law. The satisfactory result suggests that there may exist other theoretical possibilities besides the theory of relativity.

entry.title: Several remarks on ``Comments'' by A. Moroz
entry.summary: We make a couple of remarks on ``Comments'' due to A. Moroz which were addressed to our recent letter "Differential cross section for Aharonov-Bohm effect with non standard boundary conditions", Europhys. Lett. 44 (1998) 403.

entry.title: Metrical Separability of the Spin Systems Energetic Surfaces and Quantum Jumps Hypothesis
entry.summary: Metrical separability of the spin systems energetic surfaces is shown. The irreversibility of the spin system evolution is considered as the consequence of random quantum jumps on energy surfaces.

entry.title: Noise effects on One-Pauli Channels
entry.summary: The possibility of stochastic resonance of a quantum channel and hence the noise enhanced quantum channel capacity is explored by considering one-Pauli channels which are more classical like. The fidelity of the channel is also considered.

entry.title: Optimal Cloning and No Signaling
entry.summary: It is shown that no signaling constraint generates the whole class of 1 $\rightarrow$ 2 optimal quantum cloning machines of single qubits.

entry.title: Quantum Probability from Decision Theory?
entry.summary: Deutsch has recently (in quant-ph/9906015) offered a justification, based only on the non-probabilistic axioms of quantum theory and of classical decision theory, for the use of the standard quantum probability rules. In this note, this justification is examined.

entry.title: Randomly Walking 1D Quantum Harmonic Oscillator. Averaged Transition Probabilities
entry.summary: One-dimensional problem for quantum harmonic oscillator with "regular+random" frequency subjected to the external "regular+random" force is considered. Averaged transition probabilities are found.
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTeX, SPROCL.STY required, presented on 3rd Int. Workshop "Quantum Systems: New Trends & Methods" (Minsk, Belarus)

entry.title: Qubit assisted Conclusive Teleportation
entry.summary: We present an optimal method for teleporting an unknown qubit using any pure entangled state.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, Latex, revised version. Title and abstarct changed, some minor changes in the text

entry.title: Quantum Channels and Simultaneous ID Coding
entry.summary: This paper is on identification of classical information by the use of quantum channels. We focus on simultaneous ID codes which use measurements being useful to identify an arbitrary message. We give a direct and a converse part of the appropriate coding theorem.

entry.title: Transition probability and preferential gauge
entry.summary: This paper is concerned with whether or not the preferential gauge can ensure the uniqueness and correctness of results obtained from the standard time-dependent perturbation theory, in which the transition probability is formulated in terms of matrix elements of Hamiltonian.

entry.title: Continuous variable quantum cryptography
entry.summary: We propose a quantum cryptographic scheme in which small phase and amplitude modulations of CW light beams carry the key information. The presence of EPR type correlations provides the quantum protection.

entry.title: On the Abnormal Type Anomalous Solutions of Quasipotential Equations
entry.summary: It is shown that there exist solutions of the quasipotential equations exhibiting the abnormal type behaviour of the Bethe-Salpeter equation.

entry.title: EPR statistical mixture of correlated states with fractional brownian process induced by third party interaction
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author(s)

author.name: Fabrizio Tamburini
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dept. of Astronomy, University of Padua, Italy

author.name: Sergio Ortolani
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dept. of Astronomy, University of Padua, Italy

author.name: Antonio Bianchini
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dept. of Astronomy, University of Padua, Italy

entry.title: Destruction of quantum coherence and wave packet dynamic
entry.summary: The main aim of this article is to discuss characteristic physical phenomena which govern the destruction of quantum coherence of material wave packets.
entry.arxiv:comment: to be published in `The Physics and Chemistry of Wave Packets', edited by J. A. Yeazell and T. Uzer (Wiley, N. Y.)

entry.title: Uncertainty is complementary to Complementarity
entry.summary: For any ideal two-path interferometer it is shown that the wave-particle duality of quantum mechanics implies Heisenberg's uncertainty relation and vice versa. It is conjectured that complementarity and uncertainty are two aspects of the same general principle.

entry.title: A Quantum NP Solver: NP in QP
entry.summary: A attempt at a quantum algorithm for solving NP problems is presented. Now withdrawn because some crucial operators were not unitary.
entry.arxiv:comment: Withdrawn by author because the Bk operators were non-unitary and

entry.title: Explanation of Quantum Mechanics
entry.summary: By assuming that the kinetic energy,potential energy,momentum,and some other physical quantities of a particle exist in the field out of the particle,the Schrodinger equation is an equation describing field of a particle,but not the particle itself.

entry.title: On the Possibility of Unconditionally Secure Quantum Bit Commitment
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author.

entry.title: States interpolating between number and coherent states
entry.summary: The paper has been withdraw by authors
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages + 16 figures, Latex, submit to J. Phys. A: Math. Gen
